name: all_terms
title: AllTerms
description: Definitions for all terms in publishing models.

fields.name: absentTaxa
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa reported absent during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Absences can be reported at any taxonomic level. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `Parabuteo unicinctus | Geranoaetus melanoleucus`; `Cetoniinae | Aclopinae | Cyclocephala modesta`

fields.name: abundanceCap
fields.description: The reported maximum number of dwc:Organisms.

fields.name: accessURI
fields.description: A URI that uniquely identifies a service that provides a representation of the underlying resource.
fields.comments: If this resource can be acquired by an http request, its http URL SHOULD be given. If not, but it has some URI in another URI scheme, that MAY be given here. Value might point to something offline, such as a published CD, etc. For example, the doi of a published CD would be a suitable value.

fields.name: acceptedIdentificationID
fields.description: The identifier for the accepted dwc:Identification for a dwc:Organism.

fields.name: agentID
fields.description: An identifier for an Agent.

fields.name: agentRole
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of a role of an Agent.

fields.name: agentRoleIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the role of an Agent.

fields.name: agentRoleTargetID
fields.description: An identifier for the target of an AgentRole.

fields.name: agentRoleTargetType
fields.description: The class of the target of an AgentRole.

fields.name: agentRoleVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for agentRole are given.

fields.name: agentType
fields.description: The category that best matches the type of the Event.

fields.name: agentTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the type of Agent.

fields.name: agentTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for agentType are given.

fields.name: areNonTargetTaxaFullyReported
fields.description: Every dwc:Organism that was outside of the target taxonomic scope (the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope) and detected during a dwc:Event, and that was detectable using the given protocol (given in eco:protocolDescriptions and dwc:samplingProtocol), was reported.
fields.comments: This term is meant to inform a user of the data whether there were non-target taxa that were detected, but left unreported. This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods and if a target taxonomic scope is declared. Taxonomic scope is based on the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope. Within dwc:Events that used either a restricted search or an open search method and declared a taxonomic scope, if all dwc:Organisms that are not included within the target taxonomic scope and that were detected during a dwc:Event were reported, the value of this term should be 'true', otherwise the value of this term should be ‘false'.

fields.name: assertionBy
fields.description: The name of the Agent who made the Assertion.
fields.examples: `José E. Crespo`; `Oliver P. Pearson | Anita K. Pearson` (where the value in recordNumber `OPP 7101` corresponds to the collector number for the specimen in the field catalog of Oliver P. Pearson)

fields.name: assertionByID
fields.description: An identifier for the Agent who made the Assertion.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.examples: `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097` (for an individual); `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097 | https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0098` (for a list of people)

fields.name: assertionCitation
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with an Assertion.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/322/5899/261`; `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`

fields.name: assertionID
fields.description: An identifier for an Assertion.

fields.name: assertionEffectiveDate
fields.description: The datetime on which the state or measurement of the Assertion was deemed to first be in effect.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: assertionMadeDate
fields.description: The datetime on which the Assertion was created.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: assertionProtocol
fields.description: The names of, references to, or descriptions of the methods or protocols used in making an Assertion.

fields.name: assertionRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about an Assertion.

fields.name: assertionTargetID
fields.description: An identifier for the target of an Assertion.

fields.name: assertionTargetType
fields.description: The class of the target of an Assertion.

fields.name: assertionType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of an Assertion.
fields.examples: `mass`; `mean mass`; `weight standard deviation`; `minimum organism quantity`; `water temperature`; `salinity`

fields.name: assertionTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the type of Assertion.

fields.name: assertionTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for assertionType are given.

fields.name: assertionUnit
fields.description: The units of the assertionValueNumeric.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Ontology of Units of Measure http://www.wurvoc.org/vocabularies/om-1.8/ of SI units, derived units, or other non-SI units accepted for use within the SI.

fields.name: assertionUnitIRI
fields.description: The IRI for the units of the assertionValueNumeric.

fields.name: assertionUnitVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for assertionUnit are given.

fields.name: assertionValue
fields.description: An asserted value, if it is not numeric.

fields.name: assertionValueNumeric
fields.description: An asserted value, if it is numeric.

fields.name: associatedSequences
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with a dwc:MaterialEntity.

fields.name: bed
fields.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic bed from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: behavior
fields.description: The behavior shown by the subject at the time a dwc:Occurrence was recorded.
fields.comments: This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: bibliographicCitation
fields.description: A bibliographic reference for the resource.
fields.comments: From Dublin Core, 'Recommended practice is to include sufficient bibliographic detail to identify the resource as unambiguously as possible.' The intended usage of this term in Darwin Core is to provide the preferred way to cite the resource itself. Note that the intended usage of dcterms:references in Darwin Core, by contrast, is to point to the definitive source representation of the resource, if one is available.
fields.examples: `Museum of Vertebrate Zoology, UC Berkeley. MVZ Mammal Collection (Arctos). Record ID: http://arctos.database.museum/guid/MVZ:Mamm:165861?seid=101356. Source: http://ipt.vertnet.org:8080/ipt/resource.do?r=mvz_mammal.` (Occurrence example); `https://www.gbif.org/species/2439608 Source: GBIF Taxonomic Backbone` (Taxon example); `Rand, K.M., Logerwell, E.A. The first demersal trawl survey of benthic fish and invertebrates in the Beaufort Sea since the late 1970s. Polar Biol 34, 475–488 (2011). https://doi.org/10.1007/s00300-010-0900-2` (Event example)

fields.name: caste
fields.description: Categorisation of individuals for eusocial species (including some mammals and arthropods).
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary that aligns best with a dwc:Taxon. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: catalogNumber
fields.description: An identifier (preferably unique) for a dwc:MaterialEntity within a Collection.

fields.name: chronometricAgeID
fields.description: An identifier for the set of information associated with a chrono:ChronometricAge.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: chronometricAgeConversionProtocol
fields.description: The method used for converting the chrono:uncalibratedChronometricAge into a chronometric age in years, as captured in the chrono:earliestChronometricAge, chrono:earliestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem, chrono:latestChronometricAge, and chrono:latestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem fields.
fields.comments: For example, calibration of conventional radiocarbon age or the currently accepted age range of a cultural or geological period.
fields.examples: `INTCAL13`; `sequential 6 phase Bayesian model and IntCal13 calibration`

fields.name: chronometricAgeDeterminedBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the chrono:ChronometricAge.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

fields.name: chronometricAgeDeterminedByID
fields.description: The identifier for the Agent that determined the chrono:ChronometricAge.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to provide a single identifier that disambiguates the details of the acting agent. If a list is used, the order of the agents on the list should not be assumed to convey any semantics. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: chronometricAgeDeterminedDate
fields.description: The date on which the chrono:ChronometricAge was determined.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
fields.examples: `1963-03-08T14:07-0600` (8 Mar 1963 at 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `2009-02-20T08:40Z` (20 February 2009 8:40am UTC); `2018-08-29T15:19` (3:19pm local time on 29 August 2018); `1809-02-12` (some time during 12 February 1809); `1906-06` (some time in June 1906); `1971` (some time in the year 1971).

fields.name: chronometricAgeProtocol
fields.description: A description of or reference to the methods used to determine a chrono:ChronometricAge.
fields.examples: `radiocarbon AMS`; `K-Ar dates for the lower most marker tuff`; `historic documentation`; `ceramic seriation`

fields.name: chronometricAgeReferences
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the chrono:ChronometricAge.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
fields.examples: `Pluckhahn, Thomas J., Neill J. Wallis, and Victor D. Thompson. 2020 The History and Future of Migrationist Explanation in the Archaeology of the Eastern Woodlands: A Review and Case Study of the Woodland Period Gulf Coast. Journal of Archaeological Research. https://doi.org/10.1007/s10814-019-09140-x`

fields.name: chronometricAgeRemarks
fields.description: Notes or comments about the chrono:ChronometricAge.
fields.examples: `Beta Analytic number: 323913 | One of the Crassostrea virginica right valve specimens from North Midden Feature 17 was chosen for AMS dating, but it is unclear exactly which specimen it was.`

fields.name: chronometricAgeUncertaintyInYears
fields.description: The temporal uncertainty of the chrono:earliestChronometricAge and chrono:latestChronometicAge in years.
fields.comments: The expected unit for this field is years. The value in this field is number of years before and after the values given in the earliest and latest chronometric age fields within which the actual values are estimated to be.

fields.name: chronometricAgeUncertaintyMethod
fields.description: The method used to generate the value of chrono:ChronometricAgeUncertaintyInYears.

fields.name: citationID
fields.description: An identifier for a Citation.

fields.name: citationRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notesabout a Citation.

fields.name: citationTargetID
fields.description: The identifier for the target of a Citation.

fields.name: citationTargetType
fields.description: The class of the target of a Citation.

fields.name: citationType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of a Citation.

fields.name: citationTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the type of Citation.

fields.name: citationTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for citationType are given.

fields.name: collectionCode
fields.description: The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying a Collection.

fields.name: collectionID
fields.description: An identifier for a Collection.
fields.comments: For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use a globally unique and resolvable identifier from a collections registry such as the GBIF Registry of Scientific Collections (https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll).

fields.name: collectionName
fields.description: The name of a Collection.

fields.name: collectionType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of a Collection.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: collectionTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the term that best matches the nature of a Collection.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: collectionTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for collectionType are given.

fields.name: compilationSourceTypes
fields.description: The types of data sources contributing to the compilation reported.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event is a compilation in which one or more types of data sources were used. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: compilationTypes
fields.description: A statement specifying whether data reported are derived from sampling events, ancillary data compiled from other sources, or a combination of both.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event is an inventory. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: continent
fields.description: The name of the continent in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.

fields.name: coordinatePrecision
fields.description: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in a dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude.
fields.examples: `0.00001` (normal GPS limit for decimal degrees); `0.000278` (nearest second); `0.01667` (nearest minute); `1.0` (nearest degree)

fields.name: coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
fields.description: The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.
fields.examples: `30` (reasonable lower limit on or after 2000-05-01 of a GPS reading under good conditions if the actual precision was not recorded at the time); `100` (reasonable lower limit before 2000-05-01 of a GPS reading under good conditions if the actual precision was not recorded at the time); `71` (uncertainty for a UTM coordinate having 100 meter precision and a known spatial reference system)

fields.name: country
fields.description: The name of the country or major administrative unit in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description: The standard code for the country in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 country code. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.

fields.name: county
fields.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than dwc:stateProvince (county, shire, department, etc.) in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.

fields.name: CreateDate
fields.description: The date and time the resource was created. For a digital file, this need not match a file-system creation time. For a freshly created resource, it should be close to that time, modulo the time taken to write the file. Later file transfer, copying, and so on, can make the file-system time arbitrarily different.
fields.comments: The date of the creation of the original resource from which the digital media was derived or created. The date and time MUST comply with the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) datetime practice, https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime, which requires that date and time representation correspond to ISO 8601:1998, but with year fields always comprising 4 digits. This makes datetime records compliant with 8601:2004, https://www.iso.org/standard/40874.html. AC datetime values MAY also follow 8601:2004 for ranges by separating two IS0 8601 datetime fields by a solidus ("forward slash", '/'). When applied to a media resource with temporal extent such as audio or video, this property indicates the startTime of the recording. What constitutes "original" is determined by the metadata author. Example: Digitization of a photographic slide of a map would normally give the date at which the map was created; however a photographic work of art including the same map as its content may give the date of the original photographic exposure. Imprecise or unknown dates can be represented as ISO dates or ranges. Compare also Date and Time Digitized in the Resource Creation Vocabulary. See also the wikipedia IS0 8601 entry, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601, for further explanation and examples.

fields.name: creator
fields.description: An entity primarily responsible for making the resource.
fields.comments: The person or organization responsible for creating the media resource. The value MAY be simple text including contact information. Note that the Creator need not be the Copyright Owner. See also the entry for dcterms:creator in the Audiovisual Core term list document and see the DCMI FAQ on DC and DCTERMS Namespaces, https://web.archive.org/web/20171126043657/https://github.com/dcmi/repository/blob/master/mediawiki_wiki/FAQ/DC_and_DCTERMS_Namespaces.md, for discussion of the rationale for terms in two namespaces. Normal practice is to use the same Label if both are provided. Labels have no effect on information discovery and are only suggestions.

fields.name: dateIdentified
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned a dwc:Taxon to the subject.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: day
fields.description: The integer day of the month on which a dwc:Event occurred.

fields.name: decimalLatitude
fields.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

fields.name: decimalLongitude
fields.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

fields.name: degreeOfEstablishment
fields.description: The degree to which a dwc:Organism survives, reproduces, and expands its range at the given place and time.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary designated for use with this term, listed at http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/doc/doe/. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: derivationType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of the derivation of a dwc:MaterialEntity from a dwc:MaterialEntity pointed to by derivedMaterialEntityID.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: derivedFromMaterialEntityID
fields.description: The identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity from which this dwc:MaterialEntity was derived.

fields.name: disposition
fields.description: The current state of a dwc:MaterialEntity with respect to where it can be found.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: earliestAgeOrLowestStage
fields.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic age or lowest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: earliestChronometricAge
fields.description: The maximum/earliest/oldest possible age of a specimen as determined by a dating method.
fields.comments: The expected unit for this field is years. This field, if populated, must have an associated chrono:earliestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem.

fields.name: earliestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem
fields.description: The reference system associated with the chrono:earliestChronometricAge.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: earliestEonOrLowestEonothem
fields.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic eon or lowest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ('Precambrian') attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: earliestEpochOrLowestSeries
fields.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic epoch or lowest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: earliestEraOrLowestErathem
fields.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic era or lowest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: earliestPeriodOrLowestSystem
fields.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic period or lowest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: endDayOfYear
fields.description: The latest integer day of the year on which a dwc:Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).
fields.examples: `1` (1 January); `32` (1 February); `366` (31 December); `365` (30 December in a leap year, 31 December in a non-leap year)

fields.name: establishmentMeans
fields.description: Statement about whether a dwc:Organism has been introduced to a given place and time through the direct or indirect activity of modern humans.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary designated for use with this term, listed at http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/doc/em/. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: eventCitation
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/322/5899/261`; `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`

fields.name: eventDate
fields.description: The date-time or interval during which a dwc:Event occurred.
fields.comments: For GatheringEvents, this is the date-time when the gathering took place.
fields.examples: `1963-03-08T14:07-0600` (8 Mar 1963 at 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `2009-02-20T08:40Z` (20 February 2009 8:40am UTC); `2018-08-29T15:19` (3:19pm local time on 29 August 2018); `1809-02-12` (some time during 12 February 1809); `1906-06` (some time in June 1906); `1971` (some time in the year 1971); `2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z` (some time during the interval between 1 March 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC); `1900/1909` (some time during the interval between the beginning of the year 1900 and the end of the year 1909); `2007-11-13/15` (some time in the interval between 13 November 2007 and 15 November 2007)

fields.name: eventDurationUnit
fields.description: The units associated with the eco:eventDurationValue.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: eventDurationValue
fields.description: The numeric value for the duration of a dwc:Event.
fields.examples: `An eco:eventDurationValue must have a corresponding eco:eventDurationUnit.`

fields.name: eventEffort
fields.description: The amount of effort expended during a dwc:Event.
fields.examples: `40 trap-nights`; `10 observer-hours`; `10 km by foot`; `30 km by car`

fields.name: eventID
fields.description: An identifier for the set of information associated with a dwc:Event (something that occurs at a place and time).
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: eventRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Event.
fields.examples: `After the recent rains the river is nearly at flood stage.`

fields.name: eventTime
fields.description: The time or interval during which a dwc:Event occurred.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a time of day that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
fields.examples: `14:07-0600` (2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `08:40:21Z` (8:40:21am UTC); `13:00:00Z/15:30:00Z` (the interval between 1pm UTC and 3:30pm UTC)

fields.name: eventType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: eventTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the term that best matches the nature of a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: eventTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for dwc:eventType are given.

fields.name: excludedDegreeOfEstablishmentScope
fields.description: The degrees of establishment of a dwc:Organisms explicitly excluded from sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the controlled vocabulary (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwcdoe/) for dwc:degreeOfEstablishment. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: excludedGrowthFormScope
fields.description: The growth forms or habits of a dwc:Organisms explicitly excluded from sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: excludedHabitatScope
fields.description: The taxonomic group(s) explicitly excluded from sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: excludedLifeStageScope
fields.description: The age classes or life stages of a dwc:Organisms explicitly excluded from sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: This term is defined based on dwc:lifeStage (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/lifeStage). Recommended best practice is to use the same controlled vocabulary as for dwc:lifeStage and to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: excludedTaxonomicScope
fields.description: The taxonomic group(s) explicitly excluded from sampling during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: The dwc:Event to which the eco:excludedTaxonomicScope refers could be at any level of hierarchy. In the case of a higher level (parent) dwc:Event, include all the taxonomic groups explicitly excluded from the child dwc:Events that contributed to the parent dwc:Event. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: format
fields.description: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource.
fields.comments: A controlled value string describing the technical format of the resource (file format or physical medium). The string SHOULD be a controlled value from the Audiovisual Core Controlled Vocabulary for Dublin Core format, although it MAY be any Media Type (MIME type) value from the IANA list of Media Types (https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml) or any commonly used file extension string. Human-readable information about the Controlled Vocabulary for format is at http://rs.tdwg.org/ac/doc/format/ . This term can be used to describe offline digital content. In cases where the provided Service Access Point URL includes a standard file extension from which the format can be inferred, it is permissible to not provide a value for this property. See also the entry for dcterms:format in the Audiovisual Core term list document and see the DCMI FAQ on DC and DCTERMS Namespaces, https://web.archive.org/web/20171126043657/https://github.com/dcmi/repository/blob/master/mediawiki_wiki/FAQ/DC_and_DCTERMS_Namespaces.md, for discussion of the rationale for terms in two namespaces. It is best practice to use dcterms:format instead of dc:format whenever practical. Normal practice is to use the same Label if both are provided. Labels have no effect on information discovery and are only suggestions.

fields.name: fieldNotes
fields.description: One of a) an indicator of the existence of, b) a reference to (publication, URI), or c) the text of notes taken in the field about a dwc:Event.

fields.name: footprintSpatialFit
fields.description: The ratio of the area of the footprint (footprintWKT) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given footprint does not completely contain the original representation. The dwc:footprintSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left empty) if the original representation is any geometry without area (e.g., a point or polyline) and without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same geometry (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, a dwc:footprintSpatialFit is 1.

fields.name: footprintSRS
fields.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geometry given in dwc:footprintWKT is based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use the EPSG code of the SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value `unknown`. It is also permitted to provide the SRS in Well-Known-Text, especially if no EPSG code provides the necessary values for the attributes of the SRS. Do not use this term to describe the SRS of a dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude, nor of any verbatim coordinates - use dwc:geodeticDatum and dwc:verbatimSRS instead.
fields.examples: `epsg:4326`; `GEOGCS['GCS_WGS_1984', DATUM['D_WGS_1984', SPHEROID['WGS_1984',6378137,298.257223563]], PRIMEM['Greenwich',0], UNIT['Degree',0.0174532925199433]]` (WKT for the standard WGS84 Spatial Reference System EPSG:4326)

fields.name: footprintWKT
fields.description: A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the shape (footprint, geometry) that defines a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: A dcterms:Location may have both a point-radius representation (see dwc:decimalLatitude) and a footprint representation, and they may differ from each other.
fields.examples: `POLYGON ((10 20, 11 20, 11 21, 10 21, 10 20))` (the one-degree bounding box with opposite corners at longitude=10, latitude=20 and longitude=11, latitude=21)

fields.name: formation
fields.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic formation from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: gatheringEventID
fields.description: An identifier for a GatheringEvent in which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: geneticSequence
fields.description: A string representing nucleotide base pairs.

fields.name: geneticSequenceCitation
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the GeneticSequence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: geneticSequenceID
fields.description: An identifier for a genetic sequence.

fields.name: geneticSequenceRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the GeneticSequence.

fields.name: geneticSequenceType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of a GeneticSequence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: geodeticDatum
fields.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude as based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use the EPSG code of the SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value `unknown`.

fields.name: geologicalContextID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:GeologicalContext.

fields.name: georeferencedBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the georeference (spatial representation) for a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: georeferencedByID
fields.description: An identifier for the Agent who georeferenced the dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: georeferencedDate
fields.description: The date on which a dcterms:Location was georeferenced.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: georeferenceProtocol
fields.description: A description or reference to the methods used to determine the spatial footprint, coordinates, and uncertainties.
fields.examples: `Georeferencing Quick Reference Guide (Zermoglio et al. 2020, https://doi.org/10.35035/e09p-h128)`

fields.name: georeferenceRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in dwc:georeferenceProtocol.

fields.name: georeferenceSources
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference a dcterms:Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `https://www.geonames.org/`; `USGS 1:24000 Florence Montana Quad 1967 | Terrametrics 2008 on Google Earth`; `GeoLocate`

fields.name: georeferenceVerificationStatus
fields.description: A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the best possible spatial description for the dcterms:Location of a dwc:Occurrence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `unable to georeference`; `requires georeference`; `requires verification`; `verified by data custodian`; `verified by contributor`

fields.name: geospatialScopeAreaUnit
fields.description: The units associated with eco:geospatialScopeAreaValue
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. For units containing exponents, use characters from the Unicode Latin-1 Supplement character set (hex 00B2 for squared and 00B3 for cubed). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: geospatialScopeAreaValue
fields.description: The numeric value for the total area of the geospatial scope of a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Geospatial scope refers to a dwc:Event location reported using the terms organized in Darwin Core under dcterms:Location. This area is always greater than or equal to the eco:totalAreaSampledValue. An eco:geospatialScopeAreaValue must have a corresponding eco:geospatialScopeAreaUnit.

fields.name: group
fields.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic group from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: habitat
fields.description: A category or description of the habitat in which an Event occurred.

fields.name: hasMaterialSamples
fields.description: Material samples were collected during a dwc:Event.

fields.name: hasNonTargetOrganisms
fields.description: One or more dwc:Organisms outside the target organismal scopes (eco:targetDegreeOfEstablishmentScope, eco:targetGrowthFormScope, and eco:targetLifeStageScope) were detected and reported for this dwc:Event.
fields.comments: This term is meant to alert users to the presence of non-target organisms (in some disciplines called “bycatch”) reported in this dwc:Event. This term is relevant only if a target organismal scope is declared. Organismal scope is based on the combination of all of the following terms: eco:targetLifeStageScope, eco:excludedLifeStageScope, eco:targetDegreeOfEstablishmentScope, eco:excludedDegreeOfEstablishmentScope, eco:targetGrowthFormScope, and eco:excludedGrowthFormScope. Examination of the organismal scope is needed in order to identify the non-target dwc:Organisms. It should be possible to confirm the expectations by investigating a dwc:Occurrences in this dwc:Event and in its child dwc:Events (if available). The value of this term should be 'true' if dwc:Occurrences of dwc:Organisms outside the organismal scope(s) as defined at the time of a dwc:Event are reported, otherwise the value of this term should be 'false'.

fields.name: hasNonTargetTaxa
fields.description: One or more dwc:Organisms of taxa outside the target taxonomic scope (the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope) were detected and reported for this dwc:Event.
fields.comments: This term is meant to alert users to the presence of non-target taxa (in some disciplines called “bycatch”) reported in this dwc:Event. This term is relevant only if a target taxonomic scope is declared. Taxonomic scope is based on the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope. Examination of the taxonomic scope is needed in order to identify the non-target taxa. It should be possible to confirm the expectations by investigating a dwc:Occurrences in this dwc:Event and in its child dwc:Events (if available) or by exploring eco:nonTargetTaxa for this dwc:Event (if populated). The value of this term should be 'true' if dwc:Occurrences of taxa outside the taxonomic scope as defined at the time of a dwc:Event are reported, otherwise the value of this term should be 'false'.

fields.name: hasVouchers
fields.description: Specimen vouchers were collected during a dwc:Event.

fields.name: highestBiostratigraphicZone
fields.description: The full name of the highest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: higherGeography
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of geographic names less specific than the information captured in the dwc:locality term.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `), with terms in order from least specific to most specific.
fields.examples: `North Atlantic Ocean`; `South America | Argentina | Patagonia | Parque Nacional Nahuel Huapi | Neuquén | Los Lagos` with accompanying values `South America` (continent) `Argentina` (country), `Neuquén` (first order division), and `Los Lagos` (second order division)

fields.name: higherGeographyID
fields.description: An identifier for the geographic region within which the dcterms:Location occurred.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.examples: `http://vocab.getty.edu/tgn/1002002`  (Antártida e Islas del Atlántico Sur, Territorio Nacional de la Tierra del Fuego, Argentina).

fields.name: identificationID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Identification (the body of information associated with the assignment of a scientific name).
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: identificationReferences
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in the dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Aves del Noroeste Patagonico. Christie et al. 2004.`; `Stebbins, R. Field Guide to Western Reptiles and Amphibians. 3rd Edition. 2003. | Irschick, D.J. and Shaffer, H.B. (1997). The polytypic species revisited: Morphological differentiation among tiger salamanders (Ambystoma tigrinum) (Amphibia: Caudata). Herpetologica, 53(1), 30-49.`

fields.name: identificationRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Identification.
fields.examples: `Distinguished between Anthus correndera and Anthus hellmayri based on the comparative lengths of the uñas.`

fields.name: identificationGeneticSequenceID
fields.description: The identifier for the GeneticSequence for which the dwc:Identification was made.

fields.name: identificationMaterialEntityID
fields.description: The identifier for the dwc:MaterialEntity for which the dwc:Identification was made.

fields.name: identificationOccurrenceID
fields.description: The identifier for the Occurrence of a dwc:Organism for which the Identification was made.

fields.name: identificationType
fields.description: The nature of a dwc:Identification of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: identificationTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the term that best matches the nature of the a dwc:Identification of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: identificationTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for dwc:identificationType are given.

fields.name: identificationVerificationStatus
fields.description: A categorical indicator of the extent to which the taxonomic identification has been verified to be correct.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as that used in HISPID and ABCD.

fields.name: identifiedBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the dwc:Taxon to the subject.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: identifiedByID
fields.description: The identifier for the Agent that asserted the dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to provide a single identifier that disambiguates the details of the identifying agent. If a list is used, the order of the identifiers on the list should not be assumed to convey any semantics. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.
fields.comments: Recommended practice is to identify the resource by means of a string conforming to an identification system. Examples include International Standard Book Number (ISBN), Digital Object Identifier (DOI), and Uniform Resource Name (URN). Persistent identifiers should be provided as HTTP URIs.

fields.name: identifierLanguage
fields.description: The human language of the Identifier.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as RFC 5646.

fields.name: identifierTargetID
fields.description: The identifier for the target of the Identifier.

fields.name: identifierTargetType
fields.description: The identifier for the target of the Identifier.

fields.name: identifierType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of an Identifier.

fields.name: identifierTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the type of Identifier.

fields.name: identifierTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for identifierType are given.

fields.name: includeOrExclude
fields.description: A term to declare whether the instance of the InventoryTarget is an included scope or an excluded scope. Combinations of InventoryTarget records of inclusions and exclusions can define complex scopes such as all 'Aves' except 'Passeriformes'.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is use a controlled vocabulary consisting of 'include' and 'exclude' only.

fields.name: institutionCode
fields.description: The name (or acronym) in use by an institution.

fields.name: institutionID
fields.description: The identifier for an institution (Agent).
fields.comments: For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use a globally unique and resolvable identifier from a collections registry such as the Research Organization Registry (ROR) or the GBIF Registry of Scientific Collections (https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll).

fields.name: inventoryID
fields.description: The identifier for an Inventory (a dwc:Event).

fields.name: inventoryTargetID
fields.description: The identifier for the InventoryTarget instance to which the InventoryAbundance refers.

fields.name: inventoryTargetType
fields.description: The type of scope the InventoryTarget describes.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: inventoryTargetTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the inventoryTargetType.

fields.name: inventoryTargetTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for inventoryTargetType are given.

fields.name: inventoryTargetUnit
fields.description: The value of the unit for the inventoryTargetValue.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: inventoryTargetUnitIRI
fields.description: The IRI for the units of the inventoryTargetValue

fields.name: inventoryTargetUnitVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for inventoryTargetUnit are given.

fields.name: inventoryTargetValue
fields.description: The value for the inventoryTargetType.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: inventoryTargetValueIRI
fields.description: The IRI for the value of the inventoryTargetValue

fields.name: inventoryTargetValueVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for inventoryTargetValue are given.

fields.name: inventoryTypes
fields.description: The types of search processes used to conduct the inventory.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event represents an inventory. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: isAbsenceReported
fields.description: Taxonomic absences were reported.
fields.comments: Absences can be reported at any taxonomic level.

fields.name: isAbundanceCapReported
fields.description: A maximum number of dwc:Organisms was reported, as specified or restricted by the protocol used.
fields.comments: Values of abundance cap should be captured under the term eco:abundanceCap.

fields.name: isAbundanceReported
fields.description: The number of dwc:Organisms collected or observed was reported.
fields.comments: Typically the abundance values would be reported in a dwc:organismQuantity and dwc:organismQuantityType terms for the child dwc:Occurrence records for this dwc:Event.

fields.name: isDegreeOfEstablishmentScopeFullyReported
fields.description: Every dwc:Organism that was included within the degree of establishment scope, and was detected during a dwc:Event, was reported.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If all dwc:Organisms included within the degree of establishment scope and detected during a dwc:Event were reported, the value should be 'true'. Degree of establishment scope is based on the combination of eco:targetDegreeOfEstablishmentScope and eco:excludedDegreeOfEstablishmentScope.

fields.name: isGrowthFormScopeFullyReported
fields.description: Every dwc:Organism that was included within the growth form scope, and was detected during a dwc:Event, was reported.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If all dwc:Organisms included within the growth form scope and detected during a dwc:Event were reported, the value should be 'true'. Growth form scope is based on the combination of eco:targetGrowthFormScope and eco:excludedGrowthFormScope.

fields.name: isInventoryTargetFullyReported
fields.description: A declaration of whether the counts for the instance of the InventoryTarget report everything that matches the declared InventoryTarget. If they do, this enables inference of absence of detection for everything in that InventoryTarget that is included but that does not appear in the count.

fields.name: island
fields.description: The name of the island on or near which a dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

fields.name: islandGroup
fields.description: The name of the island group in which a dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

fields.name: isLeastSpecificTargetCategoryQuantityInclusive
fields.description: The total detected quantity for a dwc:Taxon (including subcategories thereof) in a dwc:Event is given explicitly in a single record (dwc:organismQuantity value) for that dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: Recommended values are 'true' and 'false'. This term is only relevant if dwc:organismQuantity is a number. For a detailed explanation, see http://rs.tdwg.org/eco/docs/inclusive/.

fields.name: isLifeStageScopeFullyReported
fields.description: Every dwc:Organism that was included within the life stage scope, and was detected during a dwc:Event, was reported.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If all dwc:Organisms included within the life stage scope and detected during a dwc:Event were reported, the value should be 'true'. Life stage scope is based on the combination of eco:targetLifeStageScope and eco:excludedLifeStageScope.

fields.name: isPeerReviewed
fields.description: An indication of whether the reference for the Citation was peer reviewed.

fields.name: isSamplingEffortReported
fields.description: The sampling effort associated with a dwc:Event was reported.
fields.comments: Typically values of effort would be captured under the terms eco:samplingEffortValue and eco:samplingEffortUnit.

fields.name: isTaxonomicScopeFullyReported
fields.description: Every dwc:Organism that was included within the taxonomic scope, and was detected during a dwc:Event, was reported.
fields.comments: This term is only relevant if a dwc:Event used restricted search or open search methods. If all dwc:Organisms included within the taxonomic scope and detected during a dwc:Event were reported, the value should be 'true'. Taxonomic scope is based on the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope.

fields.name: isVegetationCoverReported
fields.description: A vegetation cover metric was reported.
fields.comments: Typically values or descriptions of vegetation cover would be captured under the term eco:verbatimSiteDescriptions.

fields.name: kingdom
fields.description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the dwc:scientificName is classified.

fields.name: language
fields.description: A language of the resource.
fields.comments: Language(s) of resource itself represented in the ISO639-2 three-letter language code. ISO639-1 two-letter codes are permitted but deprecated. An image may contain language such as superimposed labels. If an image is of a natural scene or organism, without any language included, the resource is language-neutral (ISO code "zxx"). Resources with present but unknown language are to be coded as undetermined (ISO code "und"). Regional dialects or other special cases should conform to the ISO639-5 Alpha-3 Code for Language Families and Groups, http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/iso639-5.html, where possible or the IETF Best Practices for Tags Identifying Languages, https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5646, where not. See also the entry for dcterms:language in the Audiovisual Core term list document and see the DCMI FAQ on DC and DCTERMS Namespaces, https://web.archive.org/web/20171126043657/https://github.com/dcmi/repository/blob/master/mediawiki_wiki/FAQ/DC_and_DCTERMS_Namespaces.md, for discussion of the rationale for terms in two namespaces. Normal practice is to use the same Label if both are provided. Labels have no effect on information discovery and are only suggestions.

fields.name: latestAgeOrHighestStage
fields.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic age or highest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: latestChronometricAge
fields.description: The minimum/latest/youngest possible age of a specimen as determined by a dating method.
fields.comments: The expected unit for this field is years. This field, if populated, must have an associated latestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem.

fields.name: latestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem
fields.description: The reference system associated with the chrono:latestChronometricAge.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: latestEonOrHighestEonothem
fields.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic eon or highest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ('Precambrian') attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: latestEpochOrHighestSeries
fields.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic epoch or highest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: latestEraOrHighestErathem
fields.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic era or highest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: latestPeriodOrHighestSystem
fields.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic period or highest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: lithostratigraphicTerms
fields.description: The combination of all litho-stratigraphic names for the rock from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: lifeStage
fields.description: The age class or life stage of a dwc:Organism(s) at the time a dwc:Occurrence was recorded.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: locality
fields.description: The specific description of the place.
fields.comments: Less specific geographic information can be provided in other geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country, stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island, islandGroup). This term may contain information modified from the original to correct perceived errors or standardize the description.
fields.examples: `Bariloche, 25 km NNE via Ruta Nacional 40 (=Ruta 237)`; `Queets Rainforest, Olympic National Park`

fields.name: locationID
fields.description: An identifier for the set of location information (data associated with dcterms:Location).
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: locationRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dcterms:Location.

fields.name: lowestBiostratigraphicZone
fields.description: The full name of the lowest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: materialCitation
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/322/5899/261`; `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`

fields.name: materialDated
fields.description: A description of the material on which the chrono:ChronometricAgeProtocol was actually performed, if known.
fields.examples: `Double Tuff`; `Charcoal found in Stratum V`; `charred wood`; `tooth`

fields.name: materialDatedID
fields.description: An identifier for the MaterialEntity on which the chrono:ChronometricAgeProtocol was performed, if applicable.

fields.name: materialDatedRelationship
fields.description: The relationship of the chrono:materialDated to a dwc:MaterialEntity, from which the chrono:ChronometricAge of the related dwc:MaterialEntity and any related dwc:Occurrence is inferred.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
fields.examples: `sameAs` (cases where the subject material was completely destructively subsampled to get the chrono:ChronometricAge); `subsampleOf` (cases where part of the original MaterialEntity was extracted as the material used to determine the chrono:ChronometricAge); `inContextWith` (cases where the chrono:ChronometricAge is inferred from materialDated, such as sediments or cultural objects, in related temporal context); `stratigraphicallyCorrelatedWith` (cases where the chrono:ChronometricAge is inferred from materialDated in a stratigraphically correlated context)

fields.name: materialEntityID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Values of dwc:materialEntityID are intended to uniquely and persistently identify a particular dwc:MaterialEntity within some context. Examples of context include a particular sample collection, an organization, or the worldwide scale. Recommended best practice is to use a persistent, globally unique identifier. The identifier is bound to a physical object (a dwc:MaterialEntity) as opposed to a particular digital record (representation) of that physical object.

fields.name: materialEntityRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.examples: `found in association with charred remains`; `some original fragments missing`

fields.name: materialEntityType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
fields.examples: `whole organism`; `heart`; `liver tissue sample`; `fossil`; `germplasm`; `skull`; `cast`; `3D printed model`; `printed photograph`

fields.name: materialEntityTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the term that best matches the nature of a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: materialEntityTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for materialEntityType are given.

fields.name: materialSampleTypes
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of material sample types collected during a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: maximumDepthInMeters
fields.description: The greater depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

fields.name: maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
fields.description: The greater distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.
fields.examples: `-1.5` (below the surface); `4.2` (above the surface); For a 1.5 meter sediment core from the bottom of a lake (at depth 20m) at 300m elevation: verbatimElevation: `300m` minimumElevationInMeters: `300`, maximumElevationInMeters: `300`, verbatimDepth: `20m`, minimumDepthInMeters: `20`, maximumDepthInMeters: `20`, minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `0`, maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `-1.5`.

fields.name: maximumElevationInMeters
fields.description: The upper limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

fields.name: mediaID
fields.description: An identifier for a Media instance.

fields.name: mediaTargetID
fields.description: The identifier for the target subject of a Media instance.

fields.name: mediaTargetType
fields.description: The class of the target of a Media instance.

fields.name: mediaType
fields.description: A term to distinguish the type of Media.

fields.name: mediaTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the type of Media.

fields.name: mediaTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for mediaType are given.

fields.name: member
fields.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic member from which a dwc:MaterialEntity was collected.

fields.name: minimumDepthInMeters
fields.description: The lesser depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

fields.name: minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
fields.description: The lesser distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.
fields.examples: `-1.5` (below the surface); `4.2` (above the surface); For a 1.5 meter sediment core from the bottom of a lake (at depth 20m) at 300m elevation: verbatimElevation: `300m` minimumElevationInMeters: `300`, maximumElevationInMeters: `300`, verbatimDepth: `20m`, minimumDepthInMeters: `20`, maximumDepthInMeters: `20`, minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `0`, maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `-1.5`.

fields.name: minimumElevationInMeters
fields.description: The lower limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

fields.name: modified
fields.description: Date on which the resource was changed.
fields.comments: Date that the media resource was altered. The date and time MUST comply with the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) datetime practice, https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime, which requires that date and time representation correspond to ISO 8601:1998, https://www.iso.org/standard/40874.html, but with year fields always comprising 4 digits. This makes datetime records compliant with 8601:2004. AC datetime values MAY also follow 8601:2004 for ranges by separating two IS0 8601 datetime fields by a solidus ("forward slash", '/'). dcterms:modified permits all modification dates to be recorded, or if only one is recorded, it is assumed to be the latest. See also the wikipedia IS0 8601 entry, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601, for further explanation and examples.

fields.name: month
fields.description: The integer month in which a dwc:Event occurred.

fields.name: municipality
fields.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than county (city, municipality, etc.) in which a dcterms:Location occurs. Do not use this term for a nearby named place that does not contain the actual location.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if a dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if a dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term `higherGeography` or in the term `locality`, or both.

fields.name: nonTargetTaxa
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa reported during a dwc:Event that are outside of the target taxonomic scope (the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope).
fields.comments: This term is meant to allow the full list of taxa that are considered outside of the taxonomic scope and yet were reported in the dataset to be shared. This term is relevant only if a target taxonomic scope is declared and eco:hasNonTargetTaxa is ‘true’. Taxonomic scope is based on the combination of eco:targetTaxonomicScope and eco:excludedTaxonomicScope. Non-target taxa (in some disciplines called “bycatch”) can be reported at any taxonomic level. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `Parabuteo unicinctus | Geranoaetus melanoleucus`; `Cetoniinae | Aclopinae | Cyclocephala modesta`

fields.name: objectOccurrenceID
fields.description: A unique identifier for the object Organism Occurrence in an OrganismInteraction.

fields.name: observedTaxon
fields.description: The dwc:scientificName of a dwc:Taxon for which the abundance is being reported.

fields.name: observedTaxonID
fields.description: The dwc:taxonID of a dwc:Taxon for which the abundance is being reported.

fields.name: occurrenceID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of a dwc:Occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the dwc:occurrenceID globally unique.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a persistent, globally unique identifier.

fields.name: occurrenceStatus
fields.description: A statement about the presence or absence of a dwc:Taxon at a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: For dwc:Occurrences, the default vocabulary is recommended to consist of present and absent, but can be extended by implementers with good justification. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.

fields.name: occurrenceRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: organismID
fields.description: An identifier for a particular instance of a dwc:Organism.

fields.name: organismInteractionID
fields.description: An identifier for a particular instance of an OrganismInteraction.

fields.name: organismInteractionType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of an OrganismInteraction.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: organismInteractionTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the term that best matches the nature of an OrganismInteraction.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: organismInteractionTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for interactionType are given.

fields.name: organismName
fields.description: A textual name or label assigned to a dwc:Organism.

fields.name: organismQuantity
fields.description: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of dwc:Organisms.
fields.comments: A dwc:organismQuantity must have a corresponding dwc:organismQuantityType.
fields.examples: `27` (organismQuantity) with `individuals` (organismQuantityType); `12.5` (organismQuantity) with `% biomass` (organismQuantityType); `r` (organismQuantity) with `Braun-Blanquet Scale` (organismQuantityType); `many` (organismQuantity) with `individuals` (organismQuantityType)

fields.name: organismQuantityType
fields.description: The type of quantification system used for the quantity of dwc:Organisms.
fields.comments: A dwc:organismQuantityType must have a corresponding dwc:organismQuantity. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `27` (organismQuantity) with `individuals` (organismQuantityType); `12.5` (organismQuantity) with `% biomass` (organismQuantityType); `r` (organismQuantity) with `Braun-Blanquet Scale` (organismQuantityType); `many` (organismQuantity) with `individuals` (organismQuantityType)

fields.name: organismQuantityTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the dwc:organismQuantity.

fields.name: organismQuantityTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for organismQuantityType are given.

fields.name: organismRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Organism.

fields.name: organismScope
fields.description: A description of the kind of dwc:Organism instance. Can be used to indicate whether a dwc:Organism instance represents a discrete organism or if it represents a particular type of aggregation.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: organismScopeIRI
fields.description: The IRI leading to a description of the kind of dwc:Organism instance. Can be used to indicate whether a dwc:Organism instance represents a discrete organism or if it represents a particular type of aggregation.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: organismScopeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for dwc:organismScope are given.

fields.name: otherCatalogNumbers
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same dwc:MaterialEntity, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: Owner
fields.description: A list of legal owners of the resource.
fields.comments: A list of the names of the owners of the copyright. 'Unknown' is an acceptable value, but 'Public Domain' is not. In that case, omit or leave empty xmpRights:Owner, and put 'Public Domain' in the Copyright Statement (dc:rights). Note: Audiovisual Core guidelines on value format are less restrictive than is specified in the IPTC guidelines. Some providers use dc:publisher for this purpose, but it seems doubtful that the publisher is by necessity the copyright owner.
